question:

The vector space $S_1\cap S_2$ is:

$$S=\left\{ \left[\begin{array}{rr}
 a  & b  \\
  -b & c  
\end{array}\right], \quad a, b, c	\in \mathbb{R}\right\}.$$ 
A base of the subspace $S$ is the set:
When is a relation $R$ of a set $A$ antisymmetric?
answer2: When there exist $x,y \in A$ such that $(x,y) \in R$ and $(y,x) \in R$ but $x \neq y$.
answer3: When in Relation $R$ of set $A$, $a=b$ implies $(a,b) \in R$ and $(b,a) \in R$.

question: Consider the linear application $T:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ such that $T(x,y)= \left(2x-y,6x-3y\right)$. Choose the wrong answer.

Solve for $x$:

$\frac{x}{3} +2=6x$
The diagonal of a polygon is:
answer1: A straight line segment whose endpoints are two non-consecutive vertices.
answer2: A straight line segment uniting the median points of two consecutive sides.
answer3: A straight line through two non-consecutive vertices.
answer4: A semi-straight line whose origin is one of the vertices of the polygon and goes through the opposite vertice.

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & - & 3z & + & 2t & = & 1 \\
2x & - & y & - & z & + & t & = & 0 \\
x & + & y & + & z & - & t & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are of the form $\bigg(-\frac{2}{3},\frac{1}{4}t-\frac{7}{12},\frac{3}{4}t-\frac{3}{4},t\bigg)$, for all $t\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\bigg(-\frac{2}{3},-\frac{7}{12},-\frac{3}{4},0\bigg)$ as unique solution.
answer4: The solution of the system is the vector of coordinates $(2,-1,0,0)$.

question: Which of the following statements is correct for non-zero values of $a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i, k$?

The Fire Safety Department conducted a study to determine the percentage of households in the country that have smoke detectors. $1000$ households were checked and $875$ of them had a detector. Identify the population of interest in this case.
answer1: All the households of the country.
answer2: All the smoke detectors of the country.
answer3: All the households that have a detector.

question: Consider $T:V \longrightarrow W$ a linear transformation and assume $dim(range(T))=3$. Choose the right answer.

Ralph Edmund loves steaks and potatoes. Therefore, he has decided to go on a steady diet of only these two foods (plus some liquids and vitamin supplements) for all his meals. Ralph realizes that this isn't the healthiest diet, so he wants to make sure that he eats the right quantities of the two foods to satisfy some key nutritional requirements. He has obtained the following nutritional and cost information:

\[
\begin{array}{|l|c|c|c|}
\hline
%& \multicolumn{2}{c|}{Grams of ingredient per serving} &\\
\text{Ingredient} & \text{Steak (gr. per serving)} & \text{Potatoes (gr. per serving)} & \text{Daily Requirements (gr.)} \\
\hline
\text{Carbohydrates} & 5 & 15 & \geq 50 \\
\text{Protein} & 20 & 5 & \geq 40 \\
\text{Fat} & 15 & 2 & \leq 60 \\
\hline
\text{Cost per serving} & 4 & 2 &  \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]
	
Use a computer (Solver Add-in in Excel) to solve this model by the simplex method to allow planning the Ralph's diet, considering that $x_{i}$ is the number of daily servings of food $i$ ($i=1$, for steak and $i=2$, for potatoes).

x'(t) = x(t)+y(t) \\
y'(t) = -2y(t)
\end{cases}$
Classify the critical points of $f(x,y)=x^3-3xy+y^3$.
answer1: $(1,1)$ is a minimum and $(0,0)$ is a saddle point.
answer2: $(1,1)$ is a saddle point and $(0,0)$ is a minimum.
answer3: $(1,1)$ and $(-1,-1)$ are a saddle points and $(0,0)$ is a minimum.
answer4: $(1,1)$ and $(-1,-1)$ are minima and $(0,0)$ is a saddle point.

2x & + & 3y & - & z & = & 1 \\
x & - & y & + & 4z & = & -2 \\
x & - & 6y & + & 13z & = & -7

answer4: The system has a unique solution.

The conjunction of equations $\dfrac{2x-1}{3}=2-y=\dfrac{z+3}{2}$ determine a straight line $r$. 
Choose the right answer:
answer1: $r$ has the direction of $v=\bigg(\dfrac{3}{2}, -1, 2\bigg)$ and contains the point $P=\bigg(\dfrac{1}{2}, 2, -3\bigg)$.
answer2: $r$ has the direction of $v=(3, 1, 2)$ and contains the point $P=(1, 2, -3)$.
answer3: $r$ has the direction of $v=\bigg(\dfrac{3}{2}, 1, 2\bigg)$ and contains the point $P=\bigg(\dfrac{1}{2}, 2, -3\bigg)$.
answer4: $r$ has the direction of $v=(3, -1, 2)$ and contains the point $P=(1, 2, -3)$.

question: It is possible to compute $A \cdot B $ if

question:
Use the sample below to choose the correct statement.

$\begin{array}{ |c|c|} 
\hline
\text{Number of children}&\text{Frequency}  \\ 
\hline
0 & 10 \\
1 & 13 \\
2 & 24 \\
3 & 12 \\
4 & 8\\
5 & 2 \\
6 & 1 \\
\hline
\end{array}$
answer1: The lower quartile is $1$, the upper quartile is $3$, and the median is $2$.
answer2: The lower quartile is $0$, the upper quartile is $6$, and the median is $3$.
answer3: The lower quartile is $10$, the upper quartile is $1$, and the median is $12$.
answer4: The lower quartile is $1$, the upper quartile is $3$, and the median is $1$.

question: What are the possible types of data in statistics?
answer1: Numerical (quantitative), categorical (qualitative or nominal), and ordinal (ranked).

question:
Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{C}^2\right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
z &- &iw &= &1 \\
iz &- &w &= &1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\bigg(\frac{1-i}{2},\frac{-1+i}{2}\bigg)$ as unique solution.
answer3: The system has $(z,-iz)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer4: The system has $\bigg(\frac{1-i}{2},\frac{1+i}{2}\bigg)$ as unique solution.

Which statement about the parametric and nonparametric hypotheses is correct?
answer2: Parametric tests involve particular distributions and parameter (e.g. mean or median) estimation for those distributions from the sample data.
answer3: Nonparametric tests are generally based on fewer assumptions than parametric ones.
answer4: Nonparametric tests do not require normally distributed sample data.

question:

$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\
&-x &+ &3y &+ &2z &= &-1 \\
&2x &+ &y &- &z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer3: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.
answer4: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameters.
